alert.note: Alert for Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 8:43PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds will impact portions of southern Weber...Salt Lake...Davis...southwestern Morgan...northwestern Utah and southeastern Tooele Counties through 1000 PM MDT... At 841 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hooper to 6 miles northeast of Stansbury Park to 10 miles west of Vernon. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Weather station observed. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salt Lake City, West Valley City, Sandy, Layton, Murray, Bountiful, Tooele, Farmington, Hill Air Force Base, West Jordan, Taylorsville, South Jordan, Lehi, Draper, Riverton, Cottonwood Heights, Clearfield, Midvale, Kaysville and Holladay. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 286 and 335. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 97 and 135. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
